title: Patched member of notorious New Zealand gang the Head Hunters is BANNED from entering Australia
text:
A patched member of New Zealand's notorious Head Hunters bikie gang has been refused entry into Perth, with Border Force saying he was sent home due to the risk he posed to the Australian community.

The 36-year-old man arrived on a flight from Auckland on Friday and was refused immigration clearance after his gang membership was confirmed.

He was detained and transferred to Perth Immigration Detention Centre before being flown back to New Zealand on Sunday.

The 36-year-old man (pictured) arrived on a flight from Auckland on Friday and was refused immigration clearance after his gang membership was confirmed

The Head Hunters Motorcycle Club, founded in East Auckland in 1967, has a reputation for violence.

Since it began, members have faced criminal charges for rape, abduction, drug offences, assault, wounding with intent, murder, and organised crime.

In Australia, anti-bikie laws have witnessed gang members increasingly being deported for failing to meet good character grounds, under the Australian Migration Act.

Between 2015 and 2018, 51 of the 1580 people deported from Australia to New Zealand were identified or affiliated with a gang, although the number could be higher.

According to a statement released by the New Zealand National Party, 22 of the gang members deportations have occurred since November 2017.
description: The 36-year-old man arrived on a flight from Auckland on Friday and was refused immigration clearance after his gang membership was confirmed.
authors: Tita Smith For Daily Mail Australia
